poem:
Title: More Than Gospel, Less Than Truth

In the grey-hued Westminster dome, tinctures of deceit dwell,
Tories, apprentice to the Trump mantra, learning too well.
Fabrications spun, like thread to a loom,
A £350m NHS promise beneath the gloom.
Though some eyes see through the charade's slim veneer,
When whisper becomes shout, all that's false turns clear.
